snippet: In 1994, all the writer wanted was to see the Rangers win the Stanley Cup, and to be in the Garden when it happened. Things are different this year.
abstract: Essay by New York Rangers fan Shalom Auslander offers a humorous view of fandom as religion, and pretends to swear off caring about the Rangers' fortunes as they advance through the NHL playoffs because God has a history of dashing his hopes.
lead_paragraph: In 1994, all the writer wanted was to see the Rangers win the Stanley Cup, and to be in the Garden when it happened. Things are different this year.

headline.seo: God Has a Good Laugh When I Root for the Rangers
